Kush Queen Delta 9 THC gummies were made for people looking for the sweet spot of getting high and being totally relaxed. Our in house gummy formula is vegan, gluten-free, and made with high-quality, natural ingredients ensuring a delicious taste without any artificial additives. Handcrafted in small batches creates consistent potency and superior quality with every gummy.

Delta-8 THC gummies are an excellent choice for those seeking a milder high, yet still enjoyable psychoactive experience. Each gummy is crafted with high-quality, natural ingredients, and offers a precise dosage of Delta-8 THC, known for its calming and uplifting effects without the intense high often associated with Delta-9 THC. With their delicious natural flavors and easy-to-consume form factor, Kush Queen Delta-8 THC gummies provide a delightful and reliable way to relax, relieve stress, and enjoy a chill state of mind.

settings.question: What are THC gummies good for?
settings.answer: THC gummies are consumed for their psychoactive properties in order to alleviate pain, stress, anxiety, and to enhance sleep quality. Some of the users also take Kush Queen THC gummies to improve their mood or even their creativity. The initial dose should be a low one, and this should be gradually increased to avoid any side effects that may be experienced.

settings.question: What's the difference between a CBD and a THC gummy?
settings.answer: CBD gummies have Cannabidiol (CBD), which is used to treat anxiety, inflammation, and chronic pain without making the consumer high while THC gummies contain Tetrahydrocannabinol (THC) which is responsible for the high feeling from cannabis. Both can be helpful for medical purposes, although THC will make you feel ‘high’ whereas CBD will not.

settings.question: What side effects do THC gummies have?
settings.answer: Some of the side effects of THC gummies are as follows; These side effects may be as a result of the higher doses of THC gummies. The side effects of the cannabis are dry mouth, vertigo, changes in perception, anxiety, and increased heart rate. Some users may also have paranoia or memory problems. It is good to start with a small amount and recognize how your body processes the THC so as to reduce these side effects.

settings.question: Is 10mg of THC a day too much?
settings.answer: For some people 10mg of THC may be a very potent dose especially for those who are first time users or are light users. In general it is advised to begin with a lower dosage, for example 2 - 5mg. Our recommendation is starting with a lower dose and then you can gradually increase depending on your body’s tolerance. It is worth noting that if you are a regular thc user, 10mg may be considered moderate, as always it’s important to listen to your body and adjust as needed.

settings.question: What is the difference between Delta-9 and Delta-8 THC?
settings.answer: The two main types of THC are Delta-9 THC and Delta-8 THC; Delta-9 THC is the more dominant and common type responsible for the usual psychoactive effects or ‘high’ while Delta-8 THC though present in cannabis is less potent and may even yield milder effects. Consumers tend to refer to Delta-8 as being less intense and not as overpowering as Delta-9.

settings.question: What does a 1:1 ratio mean in cannabis products?
settings.answer: A 1:1 in cannabis products means an equal or balanced ratio of the feature cannabinoids like THC and CBD. For instance, if a product has 5mg of THC and 5mg of CBD, then it is a one to one ratio of cannabinoids. This balanced formulation is common for those who wish to benefit from both cannabinoids: when combined, CBD can balance the psychotropic impact made by THC, thus making the effect more enjoyable. In addition, 1:1 ratio also delivers more of the entourage effect which is the hypothesis that when cannabinoids are used together they act synergistically to modulate the overall psychoactive effects of the plant.
